page.title: 08Cockfield Hall Farm (cont)
page.content: They will no longer have any ponds or land liable to flooding,and all evidence of mining such as shafts and spoil heaps will be eradicated.In the long term the opencast will have proved to be beneficial to the Bainbridges.They have one daughter Joanne who plans to continue to farm at Cockfield Hall. Mr & Mrs Bainbridge keep a few horses and sheep but their main concern is cattle.They rear calves to sell at about a year old.Mrs Bainbridge rears turkeys to sell at Christmas,and keeps free range hens all year round. The Bainbridges use their land to produce hay for the animals,but Mr Bainbridge thinks he may change to silage eventually.They do not employ any extra help on the farm.
